clinical_study.brief_title: The Development and Application of "Scar-care" Padding on Management of Hypertrophic Scar
clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of a Smart Scar Care Pad and Pressure Therapy Versus Pressure Therapy in Hypertrophic Scar Management: a Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study explores the smart scar care pad's potential therapeutic effect in treatment hypertrophic scar while elucidating the adverse effects if there is any. Half of the participant receives traditional treatment of pressure garment and the other half receives the smart scar care pad together with pressure garment.

study_design_info.masking_description: The subjects and the analyser of the data were blinded.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Scar Pliability measured by the DermaLab Combo
primary_outcome.description: Scar pliability is represented by the Young's modulus measured by the elasticity measurement of the DermaLab Combo

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of Scar Thickness measured by the diagnostic ultrasound system
secondary_outcome.description: Scar thickness is measured by the diagnostic ultrasound system

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of Scar Pigmentation measured by the DermaLab Combo
secondary_outcome.description: Scar pigmentation is represented by the melanin score generated by the color probe of the DermaLab Combo. The range of the score is 0-100, where a higher score indicates a higher melanin content.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of Scar Vascularity measured by the DermaLab Combo
secondary_outcome.description: Scar vascularity is represented by the erythema score measured by the color probe of the DermaLab Combo. The range of the score is 0-100, where a higher score indicates a more erythematic situation.
Occurence of blistering is observed and reported by research staff
Occurence of skin breakdown is observed and reported by research staff
Occurence of rash is observed and reported by research staff

arm_group.description: The smart scar care pad (SCCP): The SCCP is a newly invented insert material that can maximise treatment outcomes via enhanced compression and occlusion. The wearing regime for SCCP is 4 hours a day for the first day, with 2-hour increments added every other day until the total wearing time reached 23 hours. SSCP was cleaned twice a day for hygienic reasons. The smart pressure monitored suit(SPMS): The SPMS is a type of custom-made pressure garment. SPMS was used 23 hours a day and only removed when showering.
The smart pressure monitored suit(SPMS): The SPMS is a type of custom-made pressure garment. SPMS was used 23 hours a day and only removed when showering.
